The API supports partial responses, meaning that you can select which fields you want the response to contain. It works by passing a fields property in the querystring, using comma-separated values:

http://api.clubjudge.com/v1/artists/1981.json?fields=id,name,address.city

This yields:

{ "artist": { "id": 1981, "name": "Tiesto", "_links": { "events": "http://api.clubjudge.com/v1/artists/1981/events.json", "followers": "http://api.clubjudge.com/v1/artists/1981/followers.json", "comments": "http://api.clubjudge.com/v1/artists/1981/comments.json", "musicGenres": "http://api.clubjudge.com/v1/artists/1981/musicGenres.json" } } }

Metadata attributes such as links are not removable, they are always included in the response.

Deep nested fields

You can select deep nested fields in a response by using a dot-separated syntax, as such:

?fields=address.city

In this case, only the city key in the address key will be included.
